summaryText: Wow, what an incredible message about confidence from Pastor Travis Hearn! In this powerful sermon, PT dives deep into understanding true spiritual confidence that comes directly from God. He breaks down four key reasons why we can be confident in Christ: we are God's unique creation, we are incomparable, we should live to please God and not man, and we have the power of the Holy Spirit dwelling within us. Pastor Travis uses a hilarious illustration with several church members to demonstrate how God creates diverse, wonderful people - each one a masterpiece! He challenges the congregation to stop comparing themselves to others and instead recognize their inherent worth in Christ. One of the most powerful moments was when he discussed how the enemy targets our self-esteem, knowing that if we don't like ourselves, we'll never become everything God wants us to become. The sermon is a heartfelt reminder that our confidence shouldn't come from external validation, looks, or lifestyle, but from our relationship with Jesus Christ. Pastor Travis's passionate delivery and raw honesty make this message not just a sermon, but a transformative experience that will leave you seeing yourself through God's eyes.
mainPoints: Live to please God, not people

versesMentioned.text: The weapons we fight with are not the weapons of the world, but have divine power to demolish strongholds.

For our struggle is not against flesh and blood, but against the rulers, against the authorities, against the powers of this dark world and against the spiritual forces of evil in the heavenly realms.
So God created mankind in his own image, in the image of God he created them; male and female he created them.

For you created my inmost being; you knit me together in my mother's womb. I praise you because I am fearfully and wonderfully made; your works are wonderful, I know that full well. My frame was not hidden from you when I was made in the secret place, when I was woven together in the depths of the earth. Your eyes saw my unformed body; all the days ordained for me were written in your book before one of them came to be.
For we are God's masterpiece, created in Christ Jesus to do good works, which God prepared in advance for us to do.
We do not dare to classify or compare ourselves with some who commend themselves. When they measure themselves by themselves and compare themselves with themselves, they are not wise.
Charm is deceptive, and beauty is fleeting; but a woman who fears the Lord is to be praised.
Fear of man will prove to be a snare, but whoever trusts in the Lord is kept safe.

Do you not know that your bodies are temples of the Holy Spirit, who is in you, whom you have received from God? You are not your own; you were bought at a price. Therefore honor God with your bodies.
And if the Spirit of him who raised Jesus from the dead is living in you, he who raised Christ from the dead will also give life to your mortal bodies because of his Spirit who lives in you.

Monday.scripture: Psalm 139:14: 'I praise you because I am fearfully and wonderfully made; your works are wonderful, I know that full well.'
Monday.focus: Recognizing your unique value in God's eyes
Monday.action: Write down 5 unique qualities about yourself that make you special. Reflect on how these qualities are gifts from God and not accidents.
Monday.prayer: Lord, help me see myself the way You see me. Reveal my worth and purpose that comes directly from You. Forgive me for comparing myself to others and help me embrace my unique design. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Galatians 1:10: 'Am I now trying to win the approval of human beings, or of God? Or am I trying to please people? If I were still trying to please people, I would not be a servant of Christ.'
Tuesday.focus: Living to please God, not people
Tuesday.action: In every decision today, pause and ask: 'Am I doing this to impress others or to honor God?'
Tuesday.prayer: Father, give me the courage to live for Your approval alone. Help me break free from the fear of human judgment and live authentically for You. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: 1 Samuel 16:7: 'The Lord does not look at the things people look at. People look at the outward appearance, but the Lord looks at the heart.'
Wednesday.focus: Understanding true worth comes from within
Wednesday.action: Spend time journaling about your internal qualities - your character, your heart's desires, and your spiritual growth.
Wednesday.prayer: God, transform my perspective. Help me value the inner qualities You care about and grow in spiritual maturity. Teach me to see myself and others through Your eyes. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Ephesians 2:10: 'For we are God's masterpiece, created in Christ Jesus to do good works, which God prepared in advance for us to do.'
Thursday.action: List three ways you can use your unique talents to serve God and others this week.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, reveal the good works You've prepared for me. Give me wisdom to recognize and walk in the purpose You've designed specifically for me. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Romans 12:2: 'Do not conform to the pattern of this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind.'
Friday.action: Identify one area where you've been comparing yourself to others. Intentionally practice gratitude for your unique journey.
Friday.prayer: Father, break the cycle of comparison in my life. Renew my mind and help me see my worth through Your perspective. Fill me with confidence that comes from You alone. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Philippians 4:13: 'I can do all this through him who gives me strength.'
Saturday.action: Create a personal affirmation based on God's promises. Speak it over yourself throughout the day.
Saturday.prayer: God, fill me with Your Spirit of power, love, and sound mind. Help me walk in the confidence that comes from knowing You and being known by You. Amen.
